channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Silverdale quarry smell: High Court legal challenge over noxious gas
item.description: The family of a boy with breathing difficulties who live near the landfill are bringing the case.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Church service for victims
item.description: The service remembers five people killed in a mass shooting in the Keyham area of the city.

item.title: Pub car park 'rifle' arrest caught on film
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the response of armed police to reports of a man making threats with a rifle.

item.title: Afghanistan: Refugees who settled in North West tell of fears
item.description: Four Afghans who settled in the North West tell of their fears for loved ones in their homeland.

item.title: Southend rescue: Boy among seven people saved by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard was called to reports a group of people, including a 10-year-old boy, were stranded.

item.title: Banksy: Great Yarmouth model could be replaced by replica
item.description: The owner of a tourist attraction says he has a security dilemma after being gifted the artwork.

item.title: Teenage pilot Zara Rutherford begins solo round-world record bid
item.description: Zara Rutherford completes the first leg of her journey from Belgium to England.

item.title: Who were the victims?
item.description: The gunman's mother, Maxine Davison, and three-year-old Sophie Martyn have been named among the dead.

item.title: Fireworks competition dedicated to Plymouth shooting victims
item.description: Bosses say they "thought long and hard" about holding the British Firework Championships.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Who can own a firearm or shotgun in the UK?
item.description: A shooting in Plymouth which left six people dead has put the focus on who can own a gun in the UK.

item.title: 'Your memories will never leave us' - notes to the victims
item.description: Flowers and heartfelt messages are placed in Keyham in memory of the five people killed.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: Inside the dark world of 'incels'
item.description: Who are the angry young men who describe themselves as "involuntarily celibate"?

item.title: Minute's silence is held for shooting victims
item.description: Five people were killed in the shooting on Thursday before Jake Davison took his own life.

item.title: Plymouth shooting: PM Boris Johnson - My thoughts are with the families
item.description: Boris Johnson also says it needs to be "properly investigated" how the gunman got a firearms licence.

item.title: Incels: A new terror threat to the UK?
item.description: Is the incel belief system followed by Jake Davison, the Plymouth gunman, a terror threat to the UK?

item.title: Plymouth Shootings: Home Secretary says many questions to be asked
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel says she'll be looking for answers about the shootings that left six dead.

item.title: A visual guide to what happened
item.description: A gunman shot and killed five people in Plymouth before turning the gun on himself. Here's what we know about how events unfolded.

item.title: Plymouth MP: Community 'trying to make sense' of shooting
item.description: MP Luke Pollard says the community is pulling together in the face of the "deeply grim" news.

item.title: Gurkha back at Downing Street hunger strike after being taken ill
item.description: Former Gurkha soldier Dhan Gurung returns to a protest over pensions after a health scare.

item.title: 'NHS abandoned me after I tried to kill myself'
item.description: Mental health referrals across the UK have hit their highest point for two years.

item.title: Lake District fells project more needed than ever, officials say
item.description: The organisation, now celebrating its 20th anniversary, protects the landscape and wildlife.

item.title: Plea for military to attend funeral of Shropshire veteran
item.description: Wilfred Dawson, 99, served as a wireless operator with RAF Bomber Command.

item.title: Plea to respect Stonehenge research sites in Pembrokeshire
item.description: A BBC documentary has attracted more visitors to the ancient monuments, a national park says.

item.title: Covid: 'I'm pregnant, should I have the vaccine?'
item.description: Many pregnant women have declined the Covid jab, but what's best for the baby?

item.title: Portrait artist captures Southampton's homeless community
item.description: Artist James Earley uses his work to raise awareness of homelessness and money for charity.

item.title: Cramlington red squirrel rope bridge helps cut road deaths
item.description: A bridge is helping protect red squirrels as they make a dangerous journey over a road for hazelnuts.

item.title: 'I make art out of discarded face masks'
item.description: Thomas Yates posts artwork he's created out of used face masks on social media.

item.title: From a Manchester council estate to ballet dancing in Swan Lake
item.description: Isaac Bowry is from a Manchester council estate and wants to show that "dancing is for everyone".

item.title: Hayley Raso: 'I want to earn my spot' at Manchester City
item.description: Hayley Raso says she is "a fighter" and wants to earn her spot in the Manchester City side.

item.title: The Hundred: Liam Livingstone powers Birmingham Phoenix into men's Hundred final
item.description: Liam Livingstone's devastating hitting powers Birmingham Phoenix straight into the men's Hundred final with a crushing eight-wicket win over Northern Superchargers.

item.title: Millwall 1-2 Fulham: Goals from Aleksandar Mitrovic and Fabio Carvalho settle derby
item.description: Teenager Fabio Carvalho sets up one goal and scores the other as Fulham beat Millwall in the Championship.

item.title: Tammy Abraham: Roma sign striker from Chelsea for £34m on five-year deal
item.description: Striker Tammy Abraham completes a £34m move to Italian side Roma from Chelsea.
